name: 1945年後的藝術與文化（二）
description: This course will use English as a major medium of instruction. The aim of it is to improve and classify postgraduate students with appropriate ability of applying English in research of different field of art and culture. This course will focus some crucial tendencies , styles, concepts or aesthetics of art and culture after World War II. Some important popular cultures and art languages are in the scope as well.
goals: To gain knowledge about art and Oriental civilization.
To promote creative and critical thinking skills.
To discuss issues about art and western cultures in appropriate English.
syllabus:
Goal:

For postgraduate students (MA, MFA, PhD) who is studying in art, art history or design, this course is underlining some key concepts and patterns of art and culture after 1945. It's mandatory that student has to share, present or discuss her/his individual idea and opinion with the others in this class. Furthermore, the aim of this course is also trying to clarify and improve the ability of postgraduate students in English.

Weekly Schedule:

1.  Introduction (pilot examination)
2.  What art is?
3.  Critical terms for art history (1)
4.  Critical terms for art history (2)
5.  Concepts of modern art, music, architecture (1)
6.  Concepts of modern art, music, architecture (2)
7.  Films in modern era
8.  Group discussion of critical points in art, art news. (1)
9.  Group discussion of critical points in art, art news. (2)
10.  Mid-term (1)
11.  Mid-term (2)
12.  Art today (1)
13.  Art today (2)
14.  Films in modern era
15.  Styles and artists (1)
16.  Styles and artists (2)
17.  Oral Presentation (Final)(1)
18.  Oral Presentation (Final)(2)
